Description:
In these waters lie the wreckage of several ships that didn’t survive the storm, along with their ghostly crews. 

It is ironic that their wrecks have become lodged in the rocks and now serve as a safe haven from the storm for ships facing the same ordeal today. 

Here, you can allow your sailors to rest and gather strength before the next push, as long as they can tolerate the presence of the ghosts that perished here.
DescriptionAction: Will you stop and rest here?

    "SSRewardText": "You have no intention of joining those ghosts, so you decide to continue your journey. \r\n\nAs your ship navigates the storm, the sailors begin singing a shanty to keep their minds off the specters.     "SSRewardText": "You find a place where the ship is not exposed to the storm and begin salvaging some usable parts from the nearby wreckages. \r\n\nYou proceed with caution, aware of the ever-present threat of the storm and the ghost crew haunting the wrecked ship you're salvaging. The ghostly crew's constant threats keep you on edge. Despite the risks, you manage to gather some useful resources for your ship, a few shards, and a bit of gold. \r\n\nSensing that further provocation might anger the ghostly crew, you decide it's best to stop while you're ahead and leave the area with your hard-earned loot.",

    "SSRewardText": "Some spirits go silent when they recognize your letter of marque. For a moment, you even hear the distant sound of a gun salute. \r\n\nA ghost in what appears to be an old navy uniform salutes you and points to a nearby wreck, beckoning you to follow him.\r\n\nOnce you arrive, you find a small stash of shards hidden in a barrel labeled “for military use. ”When you turn to thank the old sailor spirit, you see he is fading away, still saluting you. You salute him as he disappears.",

    "SSCRewardHealthPercent": 0.0,
    "SSCRewardText": "You find a place where the ship is not exposed to the storm and begin salvaging some usable parts from the nearby wreckages.\n\nYou proceed with caution, aware of the ever-present threat of the storm and the ghost crew haunting the wrecked ship you're salvaging. Surprisingly, the ghostly crew turns out to be quite friendly and tells you where they hid their treasure, so they no longer have to guard it.\n\nWith their guidance, you uncover a trove of gold and shards. Before leaving the area, you fire thirteen cannon salutes in honor of the ghostly sailors, who now rest in peace. As you sail away, you feel a sense of accomplishment and gratitude for the unexpected help from beyond the grave.",

    "FLRewardText": "You find a place where the ship is not exposed to the storm and begin salvaging some usable parts from the nearby wreckages.\n\nYou proceed with caution, aware of the ever-present threat of the storm and the ghost crew haunting the wrecked ship you're salvaging. The ghostly crew's constant threats keep you on edge. Unfortunately, you are too focused on all the threats to salvage anything useful.\n\nSensing that further provocation might anger the ghostly crew, you decide it's best to stop and leave before something bad happens. You sail away, empty-handed but grateful to have avoided further danger.",

    "SSRewardText": "Even though there are plenty of COT shipwrecks nearby, most of the ghosts react with indifference. \r\n\nOnly one of them, wearing an old captain's uniform, approaches you. He points to a nearby wreckage, beckoning you to follow him.\r\n\nOnce you arrive, you find a small chest with some gold hidden between two planks. When you turn to thank the ghost for showing you this, he fades away with a smile. You sense that he is happy his little treasure has ended up in your hands instead of being lost to the sea forever.",

    "SSRewardText": "The ghosts remain silent, but all of them point towards the same wreckage. As you approach, you find a ghost gazing at some pieces of rusty fine jewelry, too broken to have any value, yet too beautiful to be forgotten.\n\nThe specter speaks, saying he cannot move on without creating a work to be remembered by. He asks if you have any trinket in which he can imbue his soul.\n\nA shiver runs down your spine at the implication, but you realize that his craftsmanship might be invaluable for the task ahead. ",
